description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Speech Application Programming Interface (SAPI) designated as CVE-2024-30097:

1. Apply the relevant KB updates as listed below depending on your system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2, use update package KB5039212.
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2, use update package KB5039212.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2, use update package KB5039213.
   - For Windows 10 for x64-based Systems, use update package KB5039225.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based and 32-bit Systems, use update package KB5039211.

2. Ensure to download the updates from the links provided below:
   - [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - [KB5039213](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039213)
   - [KB5039225](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039225)

**Details**:
This fix addresses a critical double free vulnerability (CWE-415) that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on affected systems, thus ensuring enhanced security for users.

**Preconditions**:
- Confirm the system version prior to applying updates to ensure compatibility.
- Always back up critical data before proceeding with any system updates.
